sub_topic: Control theory and optimal control problems
message_1:
Consider the system of differential equations:
$$
\begin{aligned}
\dot{x}_1 &= x_2 \\
\dot{x}_2 &= a \sin(x_1) - b x_2 + u
\end{aligned}
$$

where $a=1$, $b=0.5$, and $u$ is a control input that we want to design to make the system stable. Suppose that the desired equilibrium point of the system is $(x_1,x_2)=(0,0)$.

What value of control input $u$ should we choose to stabilize the system around this equilibrium? Find the optimal value of $u$ using optimal control theory.
